creditline: Gift of Joan B. Mirviss and Robert J. Levine
medium: Stoneware with slip and glaze decoration
text: Kamoda often contrasted bold surface decoration with dabs or dots of glaze. The impression of this simple plate is greatly enhanced by this approach. He also imbued the form with a surprising weightlessness by sharply carving the foot so that, seen in profile, it seems to float above the surface of the table.
title: Plate with sloped foot
